tracks.title: The Scumfrog on Robot Heart - Thursday Night at Burning Man 2010
tracks.description: Two mixes recorded on the Robot Heart sound system at the Burning Man festival. Thursday night 2am is a prime time collage of tracks tailor made for the desert. The last track in this mix “Love Is In The Air” was not actually a part of this live set, but edited onto the mix by popular demand. The sunrise set is from after the burn on Sunday morning. Yes, that one ALSO ends with Love Is In The Air, simply because that is when it was actually played. Excuse the redundancy. -The Scumfrog

tracks.title: Robot Heart (Blud's Deep Playa Mix) No19029
tracks.description:
The next musical offering from No.19 comes in the form of the single ‘Robot Heart’, a record almost destined to be a classic before its creation. The title comes from the infamous desert parties of the same name, that Robot Heart that burners chase through the desert on bikes deep into the Playa to partake in one of the world’s most enigmatic events. It ́s been praised by the likes of Rolling Stone Magazine as one of the best parties on earth and continues to top the list for djs lucky enough to play atop the legendary mobile soundsystem..

When Art Department ́s Jonny White received the call from Gio (George G Mueller) and Jason Swamy to write the first ever song for Robot Heart, it was not something he took lightly. In Jonny ̈s own words, "Robot Heart events at Burning Man are quite simply put, the best parties on the planet". Jonny enlisted his band partner Kenny Glasgow and sometimes DJ partner Shaun Reeves who were with him last year at Burning Man and who all experienced the Playa and Robot Heart for the very first time together to collaborate on the record. This was no small task, writing a record that would somehow have to translate the uncontainable energy that Robot Heart brings to the Playa each night and into the following afternoon at Burning Man.

"This truly is the stuff legends are made of. The guys have come up with something so amazing and powerful and I was honored to be asked to write the theme to such a beautiful concept that has touched so many including all of us. Having experienced playing on the bus 3 times now I had a good idea of what the song needed to sound like, although bringing that unbelievable atmosphere to a record seemed it might be impossible. Fortunately, having been touched so deeply by our experience there we didn ́t have much trouble putting ourselves in the right place to bring that vibe to the record. I think it really captures the essence of the party, the playa and the people that make it what it is ̈ (Jonny White).

When the record was finished Jonny immediately turned to Damian Lazarus who first asked Art Department to play with him on the bus 2 years ago to write the vocal. "The record needed a vocal... it was something that only someone who had been there and shared the same experience at Robot Heart would be capable of writing. While finishing the mix in LA I approached Damian to write and record the vocals for the song. He had a similar reaction to when we were asked to produce the song... honored and aware of the daunting task: that it would be a meaningful song for so many and had to live up to the actual party. He asked for a moment alone with a pen and some paper and came up with something absolutely perfect, without even hearing the record! I was shocked. We recorded one take and that was it". (Jonny White)

Musically ‘Robot Heart’ is an instant underground anthem, deep, pulsing electronic music that defies tags such as ‘house’ or ‘techno’. Lazarus’ intense and poignant vocals cut a channel through the rich and haunting production and the sound transports the listener straight to the heart of the flame lit desert floor. The original version is accompanied by an outstanding remix from BLUD who delivers a stripped back, dub mix that is perfectly balanced and deeply hypnotic.

tracks.tag_list: Robot heart burning man 2014 scumfrog
tracks.title: The Scumfrog - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
Sunrise is my favorite way to describe the magic of Burning Man.

There are 365 sunrises each year, and most of us consider it a privilege to sleep through them. But during one week at Burning Man the attendance of sunrise is a must. In the desert, as a collective, we make things that are otherwise ordinary occurrences into sacred spectacles. We make costumes for the sunrise, we compose music for it, and we go through death-defying stunts to take incredible pictures of it. And so it goes with many things at Burning Man; things that we take for granted in the real world are treated differently on the playa. It is not just the rising of the sun that we elevate to mythical proportions, but human traits like kindness, patience, uncertainty and flexibility are also celebrated, tested and recharged in Black Rock City.

Through audio and video captures, these extraordinary treatments of ordinary things stand a chance to be implemented in the outside world, not just for those who were there, but also to people who never traveled to Burning Man, and who - through these captures - are reminded that certain basic things in life can hold more value if we so choose. With every unusually nice thing that someone did or said to us at Burning Man, with every unprovoked smile we received from strangers in its dust storms, we will be charged and challenged to pay that spirit forward the other 51 weeks of the year.  And every morning, the sun will faithfully show its face to remind us of this opportunity.  

So, the next time we need to set our alarm clocks because real life responsibilities demand us to be awake before dawn, let’s choose to be grateful for witnessing the sun peek over the horizon or through our concrete jungles, while most other people are sleeping through it, and let’s remember that we are ambassadors of that magical place that celebrates the beauty in ordinary things. 

Today is a good day to be awake!


@thescumfrog

Live violin by @TallulahKidd 
Cover image by Darrin Harris Frisby
Special thanks to the Wednesday morning drummers!

tracks.tag_list: Heart RobotHeart Acid Pauli AcidPauli Burning Man BurningMan 2014
tracks.title: Acid Pauli - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
Dear listener,
finally this year, I managed to see the man burn!
In the weeks and months before Burning Man a lot of my friends kept on telling me how amazing it was and most of them would conclude their eulogy with something like: „Burning Man changed my life“.
Well, I can not certainly say that Burning Man changed my life, but what I know for sure is that my life changed afterwards ;-)
Very glad that I made it to this far away place and I hope to return next year.
I want to thank Lio and everybody at our nice camp and of course the robots who invited me to let their hearts beat according to my pace. It has been truly amazing. 
The only thing I really had to struggle with, that Sunday morning on the Playa, was the sunlight that made it almost impossible to spot anything on the display, so please please please you geeks out there, come up with something that can work in sunlight, because we all love the sun!
Yours Acid Pauli

soundcloud.com/acidpauli
www.facebook.com/pages/Acid-Pauli/201133649776

tracks.tag_list: "Burning Man" 2015 Behrouz
tracks.title: Behrouz - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
When people ask me what is Burning Man, the most truthful thing I can say is that it's a magical place that has held a special place in my heart for a long time.  It may not be for everyone but I tell you one thing, it has rejuvenated my life and made me a better person as well as many others.  I feel the love from every human that has been in this place I have come to call 'home'.  It's made me more creative with my music, more caring and to sum it up, Burning Man is capable of changing the whole world's attitude and making it a better place to live. When I look around me in the playa, all I see are people from all over the world, sharing, caring and loving one another. Why can't we apply this to the world?
 
At the same time, it gives me great pleasure to share my music each year with the Robot Heart family.  These sets are very special and truly come from a place in my heart that it's hard to describe in words.  It's a gift to each and every one of you.  It's an honor to play on the Robot Heart bus each year and I hope you enjoy and feel what I am going through in this set.

tracks.tag_list: "Robot Heart" "Burning Man" 2015
tracks.title: Patrice Baumel - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
Experiencing the Playa at night is the quintessential Burning Man experience. The untamed energy, the chaos, the sensory overload, the cacophony of sounds coming at you from all angles, all mixed with the extreme weather conditions the desert throws at you - it is pure pandemonium in the best sense of the word. It made me feel small and insignificant - in a good way. As my ego faded I more and more felt at one with my surroundings, ready to love and contribute.  As I started playing the bus pulled out of the camp. A surreal scene that reminded me of the Pied Piper unfolded - hordes of burners following the iconic heart into the open desert. But where I had anticipated the Robot Heart set to be a big "me" - moment, it felt quite like the opposite - just adding my small voice to this large and beautiful orchestra that is Burning Man. And that is how pretty much my entire first Burning Man experience went. And it's exactly this what makes it the best place in the world. 

x

www.soundcloud.com/patrice-baumel
www.facebook.com/patrice.baumel

tracks.tag_list: "robot heart" "burning man" 2015
tracks.title: Barnt - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
Monday night. It was still dark when I started. But everyone already sensed the first sunrise of this year’s Burning Man. I had arrived at the Black Rock Desert just hours before. After traveling direct from Germany which took more than two days.

I knew that the sun would rise 40 minutes into my set. I wanted to build everything around that. But when the sun indeed appeared over the dark mountains in the distant that moment, it was overwhelming. It felt like the music was manifesting itself now, with no more help from me, and we all were traveling into a new day together.


www.soundcloud.com/barntofmagazine
www.facebook.com/BarntOfMagazine

tracks.tag_list: "Burning Man" 2015 "Oona Dahl"
tracks.title: Oona Dahl - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
Its Friday night and we set sail on our bikes to find Robot Heart deep Playa. Once we arrived we landed on the bus with a view of the moon just peaking over the horizon. Slowly it starts to rise and it gets bigger with every step up, reaching for the sky. Blood orange, some of us were confused, was this the moon? This was the biggest I'd ever seen her and as soon as I saw this magnificent sight, something came over me…. just let myself go. This may be, the Soul of the World.

www.soundcloud.com/oonadahl
www.facebook.com/OonaDahlMusic

This year I decided to go to Burning Man for only four days as I wanted to see other places before getting there, places which were like the opposite of the dusty Playa.

Those were four really intense days!

All I know is the first time I opened the door of my RV to ride my bike to go say "hello" to the man, I saw a shooting star in the sky...

I knew it was going to be a good year, and so it was!

I want to thank everyone that made this year the best. Each single soul I met who I laughed, talked and exchanged eye contact with!

Each single sun ...

Thank u

Every single atom, happy or miserable,

tracks.tag_list: "Major Lazer" "Burning Man" Diplo "Walshy Fire" Reggae Roots
tracks.title: Major Lazer - Robot Heart - Sunset Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
"My favorite set that we played this year at Burning Man was at Robot Heart. It was probably the only set that I really prepared for with Walshy Fire.

I'll be honest I was a lil nervous because I really wanted to make it run with energy for the full two hours and our typical audience isn't that used to a classic dub and reggae set. Myself and the whole RH crew wanted to create something really special for a sunset party and keep it true to the theme but to still feel like a Robot Heart set. The Robot Heart crew had told me that they wanted and entire set that sounded like "Major Lazer - Get Free" and I had to think hard about it. To keep the vibe going for two hours and for that record to be the climax was a challenge but I realized if you stick to your guns for the whole party and steer the audience in a direction and keep them with you, then anything is possible.  I hope you love it.. It's perfect for a party on a Sunday afternoon and represents a different side of Major Lazer"

- @Diplo (@majorlazer)

tracks.tag_list: "Burning Man" Atish 2014
tracks.title: Atish - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
The thing I love most about Burning Man is no matter how much you think you've prepared, you still never really know what to expect. The uncertainty, the excitement, the apprehension, and sometimes even the fear of what's just around the corner is what keeps so many of us coming back every year with a renewed childlike wonder - a feeling that seems to slip away as we get older. Sometimes everything goes right, and sometimes things just go wrong. 2014 was a mixed bag for me with some high highs (spending time with amazing people, getting to DJ in the best place in the world, seeing some incredible forms of expression) and low lows (namely falling hard on my back off of a see-saw putting me in constant pain for the entire week - it even hurt to laugh!)...but at the end of the day, I got exactly what I bargained for and couldn't ask for anything more: I experienced the unexpected.

In contrast to the previous two years on the bus, this year I played first on Friday night and took a little sonic stroll around different sounds and moods to open the night before Bedouin beautifully escalated the night into proper party mode...Pardon any sloppy mixing, we can just blame that on my aching back :)

Thanks to everyone who was there early in the night to catch my set, and thanks to everyone listening at home, Robot Heart, and Dr Burridge for the continued support over the years...Having the opportunity to do what I do is such a great gift from all of you.

Facebook: facebook.com/atishmusic
Soundcloud: soundcloud.com/atish

tracks.tag_list: Heart Thievery Corporation thanksgiving burning man 2014
tracks.title: Thievery Giving by Thievery Corporation and Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
Over the years we have had the pleasure to develop a friendship with Rob Garza of Thievery Corporation. 

As huge fans of the group, a collaboration to have them play at Robot Heart at Burning Man was always a dream, if an impossible one.

This year at Burning Man, just in time for the inaugural Heart & Soul sessions from Robot Heart and Thievery Corporation's 20th anniversary, we finally had the honor of hosting Thievery Corporation on the Playa.  Three years in the making, the product of serendipity, determination and a lot of team work, here is that amazing, unannounced sunset performance at the Robot Heart camp before an audience of thousands of burners. Thank you Dave Geller, Elliot Dunwoody, Pascal Pharmacon and the 18-person team from Thievery Corporation for helping make our collective dream come true!

Happy Thanksgiving from Robot Heart & Thievery Corporation, hope you enjoy it!

tracks.tag_list: Robot Heart Burning Man 2014 Francesca Lombardo Crosstown Records
tracks.title: Francesca Lombardo - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
I am so lucky to be able to celebrate my birthday on the bus each year, and I get to share these moments with the people I love.

On this special day when I am supposed to get older, instead… I feel younger.  Whoever has been in a desert before knows what energy and pureness lives in it, and what you as a person can gain from it.

On the Playa there is the possibility to be who you really are, and to give what you really have. This could mean you or something that is important to you.

I decided not to take any pictures this year, to see the place through my eyes and not a camera.  And every moment and every breath, got inside my soul. I was really careful not waste any of it. 

I want to thank all the people who were there to make this day such a special one for me.

Thank you Robot Heart for having me again and supporting our music with all your hard work. 

PS : Thank you Benjamin for starting 'Happy Birthday' at the end of my set - Magic  <3

Love 
Francesca

tracks.tag_list: "tim green" "robot heart" "burning man"
tracks.title: Tim Green - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
It's Tuesday night, we enter Burning Man a day late due to the rain. It's my first burn, and Sarah my girlfriend, it's her third. With little time to settle at our camp, we can't set up our newly purchased bikes. So we venture out in search of Robot Heart by foot. Arriving onto the playa for the first time at night is incredibly intense, the place is so vast. The lights, sounds and atmosphere is other worldly. It's distracting, let alone the fact we need to somehow find Robot Heart by foot in amongst all of this brilliant and mesmerising noise. We start walking in any direction, Sarah being an experienced burner knew full well the bus could be out deep in the desert far away. We ask people if they have seen it. Mixed answers get us nowhere. Scanning the horizon for anything that resembles a heart. So many things look similar. Somehow my eyesight pays off and the saving grace was the giant Robot held up high. Finally arriving and panic over we run straight into Phillipp from M.A.N.D.Y. With some time to spare before I play he asks us if we want to go for a quick cruise around to explore. With the obvious lack of our bikes he purposefully and very quickly introduces us to Benjamin and the crew from Robot Heart, who throw us both on the bus immediately. To our surprise the bus suddenly starts driving away. Everyone follows. An amazing experience as we watch thousands of bikes, lights and art cars slowly following the bus. It was like the bus was leaking - spewing out these bikes, lights and art cars all over the desert floor, leaving this incredible trail behind itself.
A good 30 minutes pass, the bus and gathered crowd is settled and in its final place for the night. I begin to play - my first gig at Burning Man, my first time on Robot Heart, all on my first night at BM in this crazy desert. All brilliantly overwhelming. Even after everything though, I am completely relaxed. It's a setting and experience I'll never forget. Playing and looking out over everything down below. You could take a picture of what you see in front of you and look at all of the different things for hours. But this was real life and in motion, always changing, so much to take in. By far one of the most enjoyable moments of my life. Which was topped only by mine and Sarah's fun wedding ceremony we had later that week in front of the Temple. The picture is our first kiss as newly weds!

Thank you Robot Heart and Burning Man! I definitely hope I can return to the Bus and the playa every year now!

https://soundcloud.com/timgreen
www.facebook.com/TimGreenMusic

tracks.tag_list: Robot Heart Burning Man Eric Volta 2014
tracks.title: Eric Volta -  Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
This was my first ever Burning Man experience. I am in fact still trying to find the right words to describe my experience there. 
Moreover the Robot Heart performance. But sometimes music really shouldn't be described with words. At least in my position being an artist & composer. 
So thank you that this magical journey of mine was recorded!
It was quite something to be on top of that bus as the burners rode in on their bikes. And when the bus took off watching everyone jump right back on their bikes and follow the bus in what I can only call a ‘mass exodus’ onto the playa. I decided to dig deep into my old productions and new and some of my favourite journey tracks for this mix.
Thank you, big hug and love to all who joined in and danced along, and to Camp David, Robot Heart & Jonny for getting me involved.
I hope to be a part of this again. Either way, I’ll See you again next year for sure!
 
-Volta.

soundcloud.com/ericvolta
www.facebook.com/ericvolta

tracks.tag_list: Robot Heart Burning Man DJTHREE dj three 2014
tracks.title: DJ Three - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
The hypnotic momentum of the night passes to the hands of DJ Three as light begins to fill sky and the new day creeps ever closer.  For forty breathless minutes we wait… until at last the sun breaks over the horizon, and a collage of verbal musings, psychedelia and ornate music fills the air.  Toying with echoes and teasing with nuance, shutters fluttering to capture the fleeting moment…a moment not soon forgotten for those who were lucky enough to be there, at sunrise on Sunday, Black Rock City, Burning Man, 2014.   And then, just as easily as we are led into that place, a whole movement of sound and energy returns the dance floor.

tracks.tag_list: "Robot Heart" "Burning Man" 2015 Kompakt
tracks.title: Blondish - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
Ohhh... burning man.. where do we start? Running into new and old friends, the butterflies in our stomachs, adventures , cruising and endless synchronicities are all part of the magic we've experienced each of the 5 years we've been coming to this parallel universe. 

This year was a bit different.. we had just finished our album, and had been anticipating playing a few of the songs from it on the Robot Heart Bus.. This was a moment that we've been waiting for a long while.. and there are really no words to describe the feeling when that moment came. We are grateful for every second. 

www.soundcloud.com/blondish
www.facebook.com/Blondish

tracks.tag_list: "Robot Heart" Halloween NYC 2015
tracks.title: Hundred Waters - Robot Heart Halloween - NYC 2015
tracks.description:
"Robot Heart Halloween was one of our favorite shows to date. It was also the first time we'd played on top of a giant bus (won't be the last). So much love to this community and the crew behind the scenes. We've only spent a few days together but Robot Heart is family." 

Recorded live on the Saturday of this year's Robot Heart Halloween we present to you @soundcloud.com/hundredwaters

tracks.tag_list: "Robot Heart" "Burning Man" 2015
tracks.title: David Hohme - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
"I had a musically transformational experience in front of the robot heart bus years ago.  At that moment, I made a promise to myself that the next time I stepped foot on the bus, it would be to play.  Fast forward 5 years later…it’s 2am Monday night, about 30 min before my set, and I’m sitting in the deep playa with a close friend watching the bus make it’s way towards us from the city.  It was a moment that I will never forget.  This was what all the hard work was for.

To me, this mix represents a small microcosm of one of the things I learn over and over again every time I go to Burning Man; with patience, persistence, resilience, and positive intention, you can achieve anything.

Infinite gratitude to everyone who's supported me along this journey.  Although this, is just another beginning."

www.soundcloud.com/hohme

photo: Christian Lamb

tracks.tag_list: "robot heart" "burning man"
tracks.title: DJ Three - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
The sunrise on Sunday morning after The Burn was perhaps the coldest I'd experienced at Burning Man.   By the time I went on at 7am only the slightest hint of the sun's warmth began to grace us, but the effect was immediate.  My instincts steered me into an uplifting, psychedelic house sound and the vibe was as loose and festive as one could imagine.  Playing out there in Deep Playa on the Robot Heart bus never fails to be one of the most unique DJ experiences I've known.

www.facebook.com/djthree
www.soundcloud.com/three

tracks.description:
This is the recording of our Friday sunrise set from Robot Heart 2015 which marks the second anniversary since our very first set together as Bedouin.  Its a pleasure to share as a small token of appreciation for all the magic we all experience on the Playa each year.

tracks.tag_list: "robot heart" "burning man"
tracks.title: Be Svendsen - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
"Playing the Sunday morning closing set at Robot Heart at my first Burning Man was one of the most touching and rewarding moments of my musical adventure so far. I have always made music with the desert in mind, and this felt somehow like coming home, sharing it in the perfect environment. 

The manifestation of an intention - a full circle. 

Thanks to everybody who believes in my work and has helped me get this far on my journey, and to all the beautiful souls and amazing creatures who shared this moment and made it a special morning.  

Much love"

Sunday morning, deep playa at Burning Man, 2015.  Be Svendsen.  

https://www.facebook.com/Be-Svendsen-187349001313662/

Photo by Christian Lamb

tracks.tag_list: "Burning Man" "Robot Heart" 2015
tracks.title: Lauren Lane - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
"
This was my first time playing on the bus although I've shared many euphoric moments at Robot Heart in previous Burning Man adventures. Nothing else really compares to playing for friends and strangers all unified by love of music in the middle of the playa on a cool desert night. It's truly hard to describe in words the magnificent sensory experience it is to be there. It feels like the epicenter of love, creativity, spirituality and uninhibited self-expression... all rolled up with the best soundtrack and visuals you've ever seen. 


Thank you for including me in the magic Robot Heart."

Photo: Christian Lamb

tracks.tag_list: "Robot Heart" "Burning Man"
tracks.title: Tara Brooks - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
"I'll never forget my first Robot Heart experience. We danced, frolicked, and got lost in the most enchanting sunrise, surrounded by like-minded energies. Beautiful and warm sounds captured my heart and spirit, creating a vibe full of magic, mystery, and pure bliss. I knew then I was meant to be a part of this experience, delivering the beauty I had received. With endless love and gratitude, my sincere thanks for those who joined in my journey after the Temple burn. It is your support that keeps me inspired"

https://www.facebook.com/tarabrooksofficial

Photo by John Dill

tracks.tag_list: "Robot Heart" "Burning Man" 2015
tracks.title: Jon Charnis - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
I still remember approaching the Robot Heart bus for the very first time during my first Burn. We departed from our camp all the way at 4 o'clock by bike, dodging sand dunes and cracks on the rugged Playa. From a distance we saw the illuminated heart, serving like a far far-away compass amidst the orgy of lazers and lights. And when we finally arrived, it was like being transported to another universe.  I was immediately engulfed by the experience.  So you can imagine my excitement and anticipation when I was invited to play the bus on Friday night of the Burn this year. The magic of the night is hard for me to put into words so I will let my music do the talking. Enjoy the journey and let it transport you back to those special moments on the playa.

https://soundcloud.com/joncharnis
https://www.facebook.com/joncharnis

Photo: Christian Lamb

tracks.tag_list: Robot Heart Burning Man DJTHREE dj three 2014
tracks.title: DJ Three - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
The hypnotic momentum of the night passes to the hands of DJ Three as light begins to fill sky and the new day creeps ever closer.  For forty breathless minutes we wait… until at last the sun breaks over the horizon, and a collage of verbal musings, psychedelia and ornate music fills the air.  Toying with echoes and teasing with nuance, shutters fluttering to capture the fleeting moment…a moment not soon forgotten for those who were lucky enough to be there, at sunrise on Sunday, Black Rock City, Burning Man, 2014.   And then, just as easily as we are led into that place, a whole movement of sound and energy returns the dance floor.
 
https://soundcloud.com/three

Following our good friend Lee Burridge past the sunset and well into the day as sandstorms whipped past us in the background we stood amongst friends and strangers (who are just friends we’ve yet to meet) and we danced and celebrated together, participating in the beauty of a shared moment that can only be held in our memories as a mere shadow of what we truly experienced… What an honor to be part of it all. tracks.tag_list: Robot Heart Burning Man Eric Volta 2014
tracks.title: Eric Volta -  Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
This was my first ever Burning Man experience. I am in fact still trying to find the right words to describe my experience there. 
Moreover the Robot Heart performance. But sometimes music really shouldn't be described with words. At least in my position being an artist & composer. 
So thank you that this magical journey of mine was recorded!
It was quite something to be on top of that bus as the burners rode in on their bikes. And when the bus took off watching everyone jump right back on their bikes and follow the bus in what I can only call a ‘mass exodus’ onto the playa. I decided to dig deep into my old productions and new and some of my favourite journey tracks for this mix.
Thank you, big hug and love to all who joined in and danced along, and to Camp David, Robot Heart & Jonny for getting me involved.
I hope to be a part of this again. Either way, I’ll See you again next year for sure!
 
-Volta.

soundcloud.com/ericvolta

tracks.tag_list: "tim green" "robot heart" "burning man"
tracks.title: Tim Green - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
It's Tuesday night, we enter Burning Man a day late due to the rain. It's my first burn, and Sarah my girlfriend, it's her third. With little time to settle at our camp, we can't set up our newly purchased bikes. So we venture out in search of Robot Heart by foot. Arriving onto the playa for the first time at night is incredibly intense, the place is so vast. The lights, sounds and atmosphere is other worldly. It's distracting, let alone the fact we need to somehow find Robot Heart by foot in amongst all of this brilliant and mesmerising noise. We start walking in any direction, Sarah being an experienced burner knew full well the bus could be out deep in the desert far away. We ask people if they have seen it. Mixed answers get us nowhere. Scanning the horizon for anything that resembles a heart. So many things look similar. Somehow my eyesight pays off and the saving grace was the giant Robot held up high. Finally arriving and panic over we run straight into Phillipp from M.A.N.D.Y. With some time to spare before I play he asks us if we want to go for a quick cruise around to explore. With the obvious lack of our bikes he purposefully and very quickly introduces us to Benjamin and the crew from Robot Heart, who throw us both on the bus immediately. To our surprise the bus suddenly starts driving away. Everyone follows. An amazing experience as we watch thousands of bikes, lights and art cars slowly following the bus. It was like the bus was leaking - spewing out these bikes, lights and art cars all over the desert floor, leaving this incredible trail behind itself.
A good 30 minutes pass, the bus and gathered crowd is settled and in its final place for the night. I begin to play - my first gig at Burning Man, my first time on Robot Heart, all on my first night at BM in this crazy desert. All brilliantly overwhelming. Even after everything though, I am completely relaxed. It's a setting and experience I'll never forget. Playing and looking out over everything down below. You could take a picture of what you see in front of you and look at all of the different things for hours. But this was real life and in motion, always changing, so much to take in. By far one of the most enjoyable moments of my life. Which was topped only by mine and Sarah's fun wedding ceremony we had later that week in front of the Temple. The picture is our first kiss as newly weds!

Thank you Robot Heart and Burning Man! I definitely hope I can return to the Bus and the playa every year now!

https://soundcloud.com/timgreen
www.facebook.com/TimGreenMusic

Photo: Haz Al-Shaater

tracks.tag_list: Robot Heart Burning Man 2014 Francesca Lombardo Crosstown Records
tracks.title: Francesca Lombardo - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
I am so lucky to be able to celebrate my birthday on the bus each year, and I get to share these moments with the people I love.

On this special day when I am supposed to get older, instead… I feel younger.  Whoever has been in a desert before knows what energy and pureness lives in it, and what you as a person can gain from it.

On the Playa there is the possibility to be who you really are, and to give what you really have. This could mean you or something that is important to you.

I decided not to take any pictures this year, to see the place through my eyes and not a camera.  And every moment and every breath, got inside my soul. I was really careful not waste any of it. 

I want to thank all the people who were there to make this day such a special one for me.

Thank you Robot Heart for having me again and supporting our music with all your hard work. 

PS : Thank you Benjamin for starting 'Happy Birthday' at the end of my set - Magic  <3

Love 
Francesca

https://www.facebook.com/francescalombardoofficial

tracks.tag_list: Robot heart burning man 2014 scumfrog
tracks.title: The Scumfrog - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
Sunrise is my favorite way to describe the magic of Burning Man.

There are 365 sunrises each year, and most of us consider it a privilege to sleep through them. But during one week at Burning Man the attendance of sunrise is a must. In the desert, as a collective, we make things that are otherwise ordinary occurrences into sacred spectacles. We make costumes for the sunrise, we compose music for it, and we go through death-defying stunts to take incredible pictures of it. And so it goes with many things at Burning Man; things that we take for granted in the real world are treated differently on the playa. It is not just the rising of the sun that we elevate to mythical proportions, but human traits like kindness, patience, uncertainty and flexibility are also celebrated, tested and recharged in Black Rock City.

Through audio and video captures, these extraordinary treatments of ordinary things stand a chance to be implemented in the outside world, not just for those who were there, but also to people who never traveled to Burning Man, and who - through these captures - are reminded that certain basic things in life can hold more value if we so choose. With every unusually nice thing that someone did or said to us at Burning Man, with every unprovoked smile we received from strangers in its dust storms, we will be charged and challenged to pay that spirit forward the other 51 weeks of the year.  And every morning, the sun will faithfully show its face to remind us of this opportunity.  

So, the next time we need to set our alarm clocks because real life responsibilities demand us to be awake before dawn, let’s choose to be grateful for witnessing the sun peek over the horizon or through our concrete jungles, while most other people are sleeping through it, and let’s remember that we are ambassadors of that magical place that celebrates the beauty in ordinary things. 

Today is a good day to be awake!


@thescumfrog

Live violin by @TallulahKidd 
Cover image by Darrin Harris Frisby
Special thanks to the Wednesday morning drummers!

tracks.tag_list: Heart Thievery Corporation thanksgiving burning man 2014
tracks.title: Thievery Giving by Thievery Corporation and Robot Heart - Burning Man 2014
tracks.description:
Over the years we have had the pleasure to develop a friendship with Rob Garza of Thievery Corporation. 

As huge fans of the group, a collaboration to have them play at Robot Heart at Burning Man was always a dream, if an impossible one.

This year at Burning Man, just in time for the inaugural Heart & Soul sessions from Robot Heart and Thievery Corporation's 20th anniversary, we finally had the honor of hosting Thievery Corporation on the Playa.  Three years in the making, the product of serendipity, determination and a lot of team work, here is that amazing, unannounced sunset performance at the Robot Heart camp before an audience of thousands of burners. Thank you Dave Geller, Elliot Dunwoody, Pascal Pharmacon and the 18-person team from Thievery Corporation for helping make our collective dream come true!

Happy Thanksgiving from Robot Heart & Thievery Corporation, hope you enjoy it! 

Heart & Soul

https://www.facebook.com/thieverycorporation

tracks.title: Blondish - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
Ohhh... burning man.. where do we start? Running into new and old friends, the butterflies in our stomachs, adventures , cruising and endless synchronicities are all part of the magic we've experienced each of the 5 years we've been coming to this parallel universe. 

This year was a bit different.. we had just finished our album, and had been anticipating playing a few of the songs from it on the Robot Heart Bus.. This was a moment that we've been waiting for a long while.. and there are really no words to describe the feeling when that moment came. We are grateful for every second. 

www.soundcloud.com/blondish
www.facebook.com/Blondish

tracks.tag_list: "Robot Heart" "Burning Man" 2015
tracks.title: Patrice Baumel - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
Experiencing the Playa at night is the quintessential Burning Man experience. The untamed energy, the chaos, the sensory overload, the cacophony of sounds coming at you from all angles, all mixed with the extreme weather conditions the desert throws at you - it is pure pandemonium in the best sense of the word. It made me feel small and insignificant - in a good way. As my ego faded I more and more felt at one with my surroundings, ready to love and contribute.  As I started playing the bus pulled out of the camp. A surreal scene that reminded me of the Pied Piper unfolded - hordes of burners following the iconic heart into the open desert. But where I had anticipated the Robot Heart set to be a big "me" - moment, it felt quite like the opposite - just adding my small voice to this large and beautiful orchestra that is Burning Man. And that is how pretty much my entire first Burning Man experience went. And it's exactly this what makes it the best place in the world. 

x

www.soundcloud.com/patrice-baumel
www.facebook.com/patrice.baumel

tracks.tag_list: "robot heart" "burning man" 2015
tracks.title: Barnt - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
Monday night. It was still dark when I started. But everyone already sensed the first sunrise of this year’s Burning Man. I had arrived at the Black Rock Desert just hours before. After traveling direct from Germany which took more than two days.

I knew that the sun would rise 40 minutes into my set. I wanted to build everything around that. But when the sun indeed appeared over the dark mountains in the distant that moment, it was overwhelming. It felt like the music was manifesting itself now, with no more help from me, and we all were traveling into a new day together.


www.soundcloud.com/barntofmagazine
www.facebook.com/BarntOfMagazine

tracks.tag_list: "Burning Man" 2015 "Oona Dahl"
tracks.title: Oona Dahl - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
Its Friday night and we set sail on our bikes to find Robot Heart deep Playa. Once we arrived we landed on the bus with a view of the moon just peaking over the horizon. Slowly it starts to rise and it gets bigger with every step up, reaching for the sky. Blood orange, some of us were confused, was this the moon? This was the biggest I'd ever seen her and as soon as I saw this magnificent sight, something came over me…. just let myself go. This may be, the Soul of the World.

www.soundcloud.com/oonadahl
www.facebook.com/OonaDahlMusic

photo: Christian Lamb

tracks.tag_list: "francesca lombardo" "burning man" 2015
tracks.title: Francesca Lombardo - Robot Heart - Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
This year I decided to go to Burning Man for only four days as I wanted to see other places before getting there, places which were like the opposite of the dusty Playa.

Those were four really intense days!

All I know is the first time I opened the door of my RV to ride my bike to go say "hello" to the man, I saw a shooting star in the sky...

I knew it was going to be a good year, and so it was!

I want to thank everyone that made this year the best. Each single soul I met who I laughed, talked and exchanged eye contact with!

Each single sun ...

Thank u

tracks.tag_list: "Major Lazer" "Burning Man" Diplo "Walshy Fire" Reggae Roots
tracks.title: Major Lazer - Robot Heart - Sunset Burning Man 2015
tracks.description:
"My favorite set that we played this year at Burning Man was at Robot Heart. It was probably the only set that I really prepared for with Walshy Fire.

I'll be honest I was a lil nervous because I really wanted to make it run with energy for the full two hours and our typical audience isn't that used to a classic dub and reggae set. Myself and the whole RH crew wanted to create something really special for a sunset party and keep it true to the theme but to still feel like a Robot Heart set. The Robot Heart crew had told me that they wanted and entire set that sounded like "Major Lazer - Get Free" and I had to think hard about it. To keep the vibe going for two hours and for that record to be the climax was a challenge but I realized if you stick to your guns for the whole party and steer the audience in a direction and keep them with you, then anything is possible.  I hope you love it.. It's perfect for a party on a Sunday afternoon and represents a different side of Major Lazer"

- @Diplo (@majorlazer)

tracks.description:
"I have a fancy friend who makes fancy hats. I told her I wanted a hat that would take us to magical places. So for my 10th year at Burning Man, my fancy friend made me a fancy hat.

This fancy hat did its work, taking us on many magical adventures. We found beautiful storms, deviant rabbits, bumblebee monkeys … And someone lost his red pants.

On the Friday night of that tenth year, I wore this fancy hat atop the Robot Heart. And we went on our greatest adventure of them all."

My set was from 8-10am on Wednesday morning, big thanks to Robot Heart for inviting me to play and much love to the astronauts, gypsies and spirit animals that joined me on the trip ....... it was an amazing and unforgettable experience <3
